alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampden; Eastern Hampshire; Western Hampden; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:27PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Hampshire, central Franklin and northwestern Hampden Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 426 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Becket, or 12 miles southeast of Pittsfield, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Holyoke, Amherst, Northampton, South Hadley, Easthampton, Granby, Southampton, Hadley, Sunderland, Hatfield, Williamsburg, Huntington, Leverett, Westhampton, Whately, Chester, Chesterfield, Worthington, Goshen and Middlefield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for western Massachusetts.
